title: Swiss FA insist Arsenal's Granit Xhaka will stay on as captain of his country
text:
The Swiss FA have given their full backing to national team captain Granit Xhaka after his furious outburst towards Arsenal fans on Sunday.

Xhaka reacted angrily after some fans cheered his substitution during Sunday's 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace. He responded by cupping his ear to the crowd and appeared to tell supporters to 'f*** off' before leaving the field.

That has led to speculation that he may be stripped of the captaincy but the Swiss FA revealed on Tuesday that they have been 'in contact with Granit' and insist 'his standing will not change' as captain of his country.

The Swiss FA have given their full back to Granit Xhaka after his furious outburst on Sunday

A statement read: 'We are in contract with Granit. We appreciate the qualities and the importance he possess for the national team. As a result, his standing will not change.'

Xhaka has won 78 caps for the senior Swiss side, most recently captaining his country in a 2-0 win over the Republic of Ireland earlier this month.

He was clinging onto the Arsenal captaincy on Monday night with manager Unai Emery ready to consult players before deciding whether the midfielder should keep the armband.

Xhaka was elected as club captain by the squad at the start of the season which gave a clear indication of his popularity within the group.

Emery is set to discuss the issue with members of his squad before making a final decision on whether he will continue in his position.

The Arsenal captain reacted furiously after supporters jeered him on Sunday afternoon

Xhaka appeared to tell supporters to 'f*** off' before angrily storming down the tunnel

Arsenal manager Unai Emery has a big decision to make over the future of Xhaka as skipper

Having been given Monday off, players will return to the club's London Colney HQ on Tuesday for the first time since Xhaka antagonised Arsenal supporters.

Emery refused to confirm whether Xhaka would remain as captain after Sunday's clash against Crystal Palace - instead revealing he would hold discussions with the club's hierarchy before deciding.

Some of those talks took place on Monday. Emery and technical director Edu were understood to be involved.
description: The Swiss FA revealed on Tuesday that they have been 'in contact with Granit' and insist 'his standing will not change' as captain of his country, despite his furious outburst towards Arsenal fans.
